exercises.name: Push-ups
exercises.description: Strengthen your upper body with this classic exercise. Start in a plank position, lower your body until your chest nearly touches the ground, then push back up.

exercises.name: Squats
exercises.description: Work your lower body by squatting down as if sitting in a chair, then standing back up. Keep your back straight and knees aligned with your toes.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.description: Engage your core muscles by holding a plank position, with your body in a straight line from head to heels. Aim to hold for as long as possible.

exercises.name: Lunges
exercises.description: Target your legs and glutes with lunges. Step forward with one leg, lowering your body until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle, then return to standing.

exercises.name: Burpees
exercises.description: Get your heart rate up with burpees. Begin in a standing position, drop into a squat, kick your feet back into a plank, do a push-up, then jump back to standing.

exercises.name: Bicycle Crunches
exercises.description: Work your abs with bicycle crunches. Lie on your back, bring your knees up, and perform a cycling motion with your legs while twisting your torso to touch your elbow to the opposite knee.

exercises.name: Jumping Jacks
exercises.description: Warm up and improve cardiovascular fitness with jumping jacks. Jump your legs out while raising your arms overhead, then jump back to the starting position.

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
exercises.description: Challenge your core and cardio with mountain climbers. Start in a plank position, then alternate bringing your knees towards your chest in a running motion.

exercises.name: Russian Twists
exercises.description: Strengthen your obliques with Russian twists. Sit on the ground, lean back slightly, lift your feet off the ground, and twist your torso from side to side while holding a weight or your hands together.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Rows
exercises.description: Build upper body strength with dumbbell rows. Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, hinge forward at the hips, and pull the weights up towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.

exercises.name: Wall Sits
exercises.description: Strengthen your leg muscles with wall sits. Sit against a wall with your knees at a 90-degree angle and hold the position for as long as possible.

exercises.name: Push-up Variations
exercises.description: Add variety to your push-up routine with variations like wide grip, close grip, or incline push-ups to target different areas of the chest and arms.

exercises.name: Deadlifts
exercises.description: Build lower body and back strength with deadlifts. Stand with feet hip-width apart, hinge at the hips, and lower the weights towards the ground while keeping your back straight, then return to standing.

exercises.name: Leg Raises
exercises.description: Target your lower abs with leg raises. Lie on your back, raise your legs towards the ceiling, then slowly lower them back down without letting them touch the ground.

exercises.name: Jump Squats
exercises.description: Add explosiveness to your squat routine with jump squats. Perform a regular squat, then explode upwards into a jump before returning to the squat position.

exercises.name: Tricep Dips
exercises.description: Tone the back of your arms with tricep dips. Sit on the edge of a chair or bench, place your hands next to your hips, and lift your body off the seat, then bend your elbows to lower your body towards the ground.

exercises.name: High Knees
exercises.description: Boost your heart rate and work your lower body with high knees. Run in place while lifting your knees as high as possible towards your chest.

exercises.name: Calf Raises
exercises.description: Strengthen your calf muscles with calf raises. Stand with feet hip-width apart, raise onto the balls of your feet, then lower back down.

exercises.name: Skipping Rope
exercises.description: Burn calories and improve coordination with skipping rope exercises. Jump over the rope with both feet, aiming for a steady rhythm.

exercises.name: Side Planks
exercises.description: Work your obliques and core stability with side planks. Lie on your side with legs stacked, prop yourself up on one forearm, and lift your hips off the ground, creating a straight line from head to heels.

exercises.name: Reverse Lunges
exercises.description: Target your glutes and hamstrings with reverse lunges. Step backward with one leg, lowering your body until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle, then return to standing.
